results.title: On time
results.creator_credit: Department of the Interior, Eric Thompson and Victorian Railways
results.brief_description: More than 100,000 train passengers pass through the gates at Flinders Street Station, Melbourne each day. Control of passenger and freight trains in and out of the station on time is a masterpiece of precision planning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Department of the Interior, Eric Thompson and Victorian Railways

results.title: The Queen Returns
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Stanley Hawes and Frank Bagnall
results.brief_description: The visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth and His Royal Highness Prince Phillip to Australia. Much of the film is devoted to Canberra and its history as the Queen’s visit coincided with Canberra’s Jubilee Celebrations.

results.title: Volcano high = Whasango
results.creator_credit: Tae-kyun Kim, Cha Sung-jai, Sidus, Cinema Service and Media Asia Group
results.brief_description: Peer group pressure at High School is on a whole other level when the students go to a fantastical school for those good in martial arts. Students and teachers alike seem to be gifted but there is the usual pecking order of the leaders and the losers. Onto his ninth school, the new boy nicknamed ‘transfer’ is set upon by the nasty leader of the schoolyard, Ryang, but he is surprised by the new boy’s power. Teenagers battle it out in this mythical and fun filled fight film full of whimsy and slapstick.

results.title: Swarm
results.brief_description:
Sound and image projection specifically commissioned for Eyes Lies and Illusions in 2006.

Swarm, in the tradition of the phantasmagoria, hides the technology by which its effects are created. Multiple projections, motion sensors and speakers create the sense that the gallery is inhabited by insects, which emerge from a throbbing hive in a dark corner of the building to fly across the displays or swoop around visitors to the gallery. The work is unable to be seen in its entirety from any one place, it has no frame, no apparent beginning nor end. The bugs are free to move through the gallery space, just as we are. Swarm reacts to our presence, yet is beyond our control.

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins, Peter McDonald and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Peter McDonald’s Harvey takes the notion of ‘finding your other half’ to its logical and very gory conclusion. In stark black and white, a woman is spied on by an unseen man who lives in the apartment across from her. When the woman falls in the shower and is knocked unconscious, the man takes this opportunity to finally reveal his true, mangled self. Cast features Nicholas Hope as Harvey and Lisa Angove as Lily.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins, Peter McDonald and AFTRS

results.title: Dummy
results.brief_description: Pregnant with absence, ‘Dummy’ depicts desolate urban and suburban environments. Filmed in and around Melbourne, these everyday, expectant spaces are captured with formal elegance and an accidental beauty that reveals a unique insight into the secret and forgotten life of Melbourne.
